title: Rakan is a support that is designed to be flashy rather than being a background cc/heal/peel bot
body:
Could it be that Riot has made a support champion that would be appealing to play for someone who isn't a support main?

The big complaints about being a support is that they don't get commended for their performance even though they play a large role in actually winning a game because they usually are a background heal/shield support or a frontline tank/cc suppport. With Rakan however, his kit has been designed to be captivating, with flashy elements in his kit and an ultimate that makes lights and sounds when he's making plays.

I feel like we could end up seeing Rakan become a popular champion, even though he's locked fairly solidly in one of League's less popular roles. Anyone else think so?

While I think RIOT has done very well by making a "duo" of champions, Rakan has two major design flaws that will considerably making him a less interesting support pick:

1 he synergies specifically with the adc. or more correct to say specifically with a single adc. For support to be popular support champions need synergy with mid lane and jungler (role that can support and participate in plays) at the expense of adc (a role that wants to not make plays and for the support to stay as a defensive element). 

2 he has a heal / shield for allies. The heal/shield/buff play pattern is sucky.

1) The synergies are rather occasional boons, not make or break. More of incentives to play with her, but he synergizes with mobile adc's playstyles more(the extra dash range on e is nice, but not something to prioritize. The recall syncing is great, but only occasionally useful. And the her w applying to him might be useful if it applied her onhit/damage, or you built on hit/damage, but neither is true so it is not very impactful). And because he synergizes with mobile people, that means he will synergize with Lee Sin, a popular jungle, Yasuo, a popular mid/top, and Ahri, a semi-popular mid(those are the first that popped into my head, not the complete list)

2) Speak for yourself. If you want a support that doesn't heal or shield others, you may play any of the supports released into the pool since Nami(Bard and Thresh's w's shield/heal are not really core parts of their kits, they are there more for the yoink/speedboost). I love mobile people, but I love the enchanting playstyle more. Up to this point, I was lamenting the fact that: 
a) we didn't have a male, non-tanky enchanter
b) we didn't have a mobile support(So far the most mobile we have is a top laner that converted to support who could drag himself to walls, Soraka's speedboost, Janna's natural speed, a few "drag yourself to them" hooks, and Bard's ms chime boost and e. Many out of combat speediness, but no in combat dashes.)
and c) we haven't had an enchanter in nearly 5 years(Nami by the way, so you have 4-5 years of supports that you could pick from)

 And finally I get to have all!
